title: Doodle Jump
overview: Assembly implementation of the popular video game 'Doodle Jump'
points: Written completely from scratch using MIPS Assembly
Includes complete graphics and animations similar to the mobile game

title: t-cao19.github.io
overview: A webpage built completely from scratch using Angular to showcase all my accomplishments
points: Technologies involved included Angular, TypeScript/JavaScript and HTML/CSS
Webpage is fully adapted for screens of all size

title: Find Dining Scarborough
emphasis: Best Project - City of Toronto & The BRIDGE UTSC
overview: Food ordering web platform designed specifically for the Scarborough community to highlight their culinary backgrounds and stories by implementing pages that showcased owner profiles
points: Technologies involved included Angular, TypeScript/JavaScript and HTML/CSS
Selected by the City of Toronto and the BRDIGE UTSC as winning project out of 4 other software engineer student groups
Worked in a team of 5 as front-end developer and project coordinator

title: Royal Castle Hero
overview: Video game written in Python that simulated 'Tower Fortress' on Nitrome
points: Technologies involved included Python 2.7 and PyGame
